page.title: 13Holiday chalets Llanddulas
page.content: There are 82 chalets on a cliff-top, set between the quarry and Llanddulas village,near the Llanddulas Hall Country club.There are also chalets on the beach,near the railway line.The chalets are a local landmark,looking like multi-coloured model houses from the coast road below.They have balconies,and are built on stilts because of the very steep slope.The chalets are made of wood,with steel stilts.They are for holiday-makers' rest and leisure. All the chalets have very nice facilities,and people come from all over the Northwest and Midlands for holidays,mostly Merseyside and Man- chester.The holiday-makers swell the village population in summer by between 500 and 1000 people,which is very good for village trade,pubs and shops.
